days.title: Setup and First Program
activities: Write and run your first program
days.practice: Run the "Hello, World!" program with 3 different messages.

days.title: Variables and Data Types
activities: Learn int, float64, string, bool types
days.codeSnippet:
name := "Alex"
age := 25
height := 1.75
isStudent := true
fmt.Printf("%s is %d years old, %.2f meters tall
", name, age, height)
days.practice: Write a program that contains your own information.

days.title: Operators and Conditionals
days.practice: Make a simple calculator (2 numbers + operator).

days.title: Loops
days.practice: Print odd numbers from 1-100, create a FizzBuzz game.

days.title: Functions
days.practice: Create a function library for math operations.

days.title: Arrays
days.codeSnippet:
var numbers [5]int
numbers[0] = 10
numbers[1] = 20

temperatures := [7]float64{22.5, 23.1, 21.8, 24.0, 23.5, 22.0, 21.5}
days.practice: Calculate the average of a week's temperature values.

days.title: Slices
days.practice: Create a to-do list (add, delete).

days.title: Maps
days.practice: Make a word counter (frequency of words in a text).

days.title: Structs
days.practice: Student information system (struct + method).

days.title: Pointers

weeks.title: Week 3: Error Handling and File I/O

days.title: Error Handling
days.practice: Write a safe file reading function.

days.title: Reading Files
days.practice: Write a program to analyze a log file.

days.title: Writing Files
days.codeSnippet:
// Simple write
err := os.WriteFile("output.txt", []byte("content"), 0644)

// Append
file, _ := os.OpenFile("log.txt", os.O_APPEND|os.O_CREATE|os.O_WRONLY, 0644)
file.WriteString("new line\
")
file.Close()
days.practice: Create a simple journal application.

days.title: JSON Operations
days.practice: Build a system that reads and writes a config file.

days.title: String Manipulation
days.codeSnippet:
import "strings"

s := "Hello World"
strings.Contains(s, "World")      // true
strings.Split(s, " ")             // ["Hello", "World"]
strings.ToUpper(s)                // "HELLO WORLD"
strings.ReplaceAll(s, "l", "x")   // "Hexxo Worxd"

// Strconv
num, _ := strconv.Atoi("42")
str := strconv.Itoa(42)
days.practice: Text cleaning tool (trim, lowercase, etc.).

days.title: Interface Basics
days.practice: Create a common interface for different shapes.

days.title: Interface Use Cases
days.practice: A generic function that handles different data types.

days.title: Defer, Panic, Recover
days.practice: Functions that perform safe file operations.

days.title: Goroutines
days.practice: Run multiple tasks concurrently.

days.title: Channels
days.practice: Implement the Producer-Consumer pattern.

days.title: Go Modules
days.codeSnippet:
go mod init github.com/user/project
go get github.com/gorilla/mux
go mod tidy
days.practice: Create your own module and add a 3rd party package.

days.title: Package Organization
days.codeSnippet:
myapp/
├── cmd/
│   └── main.go
├── internal/
│   ├── models/
│   └── handlers/
├── pkg/
│   └── utils/
├── go.mod
└── go.sum

days.title: HTTP Server Basics

days.title: HTTP Handlers and Mux
days.codeSnippet:
mux := http.NewServeMux()
mux.HandleFunc("/%", homeHandler)
mux.HandleFunc("/about", aboutHandler)
http.ListenAndServe(":8080", mux)
days.practice: Create RESTful endpoints.

days.title: JSON API
days.practice: Create CRUD API endpoints.

days.title: Middleware
days.practice: Write an authentication middleware.

days.title: Gorilla Mux
days.codeSnippet:
r := mux.NewRouter()
r.HandleFunc("/users/{id}", getUserHandler).Methods("GET")

vars := mux.Vars(r)
id := vars["id"]
days.practice: Develop an API with parameterized routes.

days.title: database/sql Package
days.practice: Create and connect to a SQLite database.

days.title: CRUD - Create & Read
days.practice: Create a user table and add data.

days.title: CRUD - Update & Delete
days.practice: Write full CRUD functions.

days.title: Transactions
days.codeSnippet:
tx, _ := db.Begin()
stmt, _ := tx.Prepare("INSERT INTO users(name) VALUES(?)")
_, err := stmt.Exec("Alex")
if err != nil {
    tx.Rollback()
    return
}
tx.Commit()
days.practice: A safe transfer operation with a transaction.

days.title: ORM - GORM Basics
days.practice: Create a simple blog model with GORM.

days.practice: Create a config struct and load it from env.

days.title: Logging
days.practice: Build a system that supports different log levels.

days.title: HTTP Client
days.practice: A program that fetches data from a weather API.

days.title: Working with Time
days.codeSnippet:
now := time.Now()
fmt.Println(now.Format("2006-01-02"))

timer := time.NewTimer(2 * time.Second)
<-timer.C
days.practice: Create a countdown timer or a pomodoro timer.

days.title: Regular Expressions
days.codeSnippet:
emailRegex := regexp.MustCompile(`^[a-z0-9._%+\-]+@[a-z0-9.\-]+\.[a-z]{2,}$`)
isValid := emailRegex.MatchString("test@example.com")
days.practice: Create an email, phone, and URL validator.

days.title: Select Statement
days.practice: A system that collects data from multiple sources.

days.title: Mutex and Sync
days.codeSnippet:
c.mu.Lock()
c.value++
c.mu.Unlock()

var wg sync.WaitGroup
wg.Add(1)
wg.Done()
wg.Wait()
days.practice: Thread-safe cache implementation.

days.title: Atomic Operations
days.codeSnippet:
atomic.AddInt64(&counter, 1)
val := atomic.LoadInt64(&counter)
days.practice: Create a performance counter system.

days.title: Docker Basics

FROM golang:1.21-alpine AS builder
...
FROM alpine:latest
COPY --from=builder /app/main .

days.title: Graceful Shutdown
days.codeSnippet:
quit := make(chan os.Signal, 1)
signal.Notify(quit, syscall.SIGINT)
<-quit
srv.Shutdown(ctx)
days.practice: Shutdown that cleanly closes database connections.

days.practice: Add and visualize Prometheus metrics.

import _ "net/http/pprof"

var pool = sync.Pool{...}
